Blue Collar Bioinformatics

Biological data analysis, validation and visualization

Blue Collar Bioinformatics (bcbio) is community-developed variant calling, RNA-seq and small RNA analysis. Rapid improvements in high throughput sequencing and associated analysis tools requires continuous validation, benchmarking and tuning of analysis infrastructure. All of this development work is pre-competitive and shared across academic labs, start-ups and larger organizations, making it a great space for open, collaborative work. Itâ€™s the raw input to the important science we want to do: understand diverse populations, characterize disease mechanisms and contribute to treatments.

This blog contains articles related to bcbio development, validation and the open source bioinformatics community:

  • Validated variant calling for germline populations and somatic cancer samples
  • Valiation of multiple variant types, including single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) and small insertions/deletions and larger structural rearrangements
  • Infrastructure development, including Docker containerization and cloud support on Amazon Web Services
  • Benchmarking analysis run times across different compute architectures
  • The open source community, including meetings and collaborative codefests
  • Older how-to posts, describing smaller bioinformatics analyses

Support

This work is possible thanks to collaborations with our group in the Bioinformatics Core at Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health. We appreciate all of our collaborators who understand and support the value of validated, open, community-developed science:

  • AstraZeneca Oncology
  • Wolfson Wohl Cancer Research Centre
  • Tanzi Lab at Massachusetts General Hospital
  • Harvard FAS Research Computing
  • Biogen
  • Microsoft Research eScience
  • Dell Life Sciences
  • Intel Life Sciences
  • Archon Genomics XPrize
